ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot more about certain aspects of the media and personal motives for a lot of writing, as well as improving my own writing.
I appreciate sports more than before. I know how to use critical thinkings to analyze sports and related events. By writing responses and essays, I also improved my English writing.
Film analysis and close reading skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There is a lot of reading material and sometimes not enough time to do them given other summer activities or internships, etc. other than that great material and fun class. Could definitely see it being way more fun in person.

Strengths: Students have many opportunities to share their ideas. There were responses writing, presentation and film discussion for every class. The reserved films and articles were rich. The topics of the lectures cover a wide range.

Weakness: I hope there could be more sports in developing countries or fewer popular sports. It was a little pity that we didn't have access to a deeper discussion of these sports although some of these sports were taken into students' presentations.
Strength is the amount of work and the knowledge of the professor. Weakness is that the class was quite lethargic at times.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It was fun class that was very interesting to me, and probably would be to a lot of people, as it focuses on sports.
Yes, if interested in sports and love sports film. Talks a lot about history of sports and social justice issues within sport as well.

It depends on the student's learning habits. The pace of this lecture was not fast, giving students a larger space to find out the answers by discussing and thinking. If a student prefers the faster motion, this lecture was not suitable for the student. If a student wants to have an understanding of sports, this lecture is a very good opportunity.
Yes! Super interesting course if you are interested in sports.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
